title: Quadratic Voting
author: CivHub
summary: A voting system that allows participants to allocate votes to express the strength of their preferences, using quadratic cost scaling to prevent vote hoarding.
outputs: Weighted results based on credit allocation

steps.label: Proposal Setup
steps.description: Administrators define a set of options for participants to vote on.

steps.label: Credit Allocation
steps.description: Each participant is given a fixed number of voting credits (e.g., 100).

steps.label: Quadratic Voting
steps.description: Participants allocate credits to options. The cost of each additional vote increases quadratically (e.g., 1 vote = 1 credit, 2 votes = 4 credits, etc.).

steps.label: Tally and Reporting
steps.description: Votes are tallied. Results reflect preference strength while penalizing dominance.

dependencies: Voting interface that supports quadratic cost logic
